data.question: What is the empirical formula of Rh-1S?
At what temperature (K) were the crystal data for Rh-2S collected?
What crystal system does Rh-1R belong to?
How many independent reflections were there for Rh-2R?
What is the space group of Rh-2S?
What method was used for absorption correction for Rh-1S?
What is the volume (Ã…3) of the crystal system for Rh-1R?
Is the crystal system of Rh-2R tetragonal?
Does Rh-1S have a higher formula weight than Rh-2S?
Was the Flack parameter for Rh-1S determined to be 0.095?
Was a TWIN law detected for Rh-2R according to PLATON instruction?
Is the density (calculated) of Rh-1S higher than that of Rh-2R?
What is the reason for using the SQUEEZE algorithm in the refinement of Rh-1S?
data.answer: There were disordered anions and solvents which could not be restrained properly.

data.question: Why was the absolute structure of Rh-1R correctly determined by comparing the chirality of D-valine with the ligand structure?
data.answer: Because no TWIN law was detected, and the chirality of D-valine matches the ligand structure.

data.question: How does the presence of disordered anions and solvents affect the refinement process of Rh-2S?
data.answer: It necessitates the use of the SQUEEZE algorithm to omit them for proper refinement.

data.question: What is the significance of the Flack parameter in the refinement of Rh-1R?
data.answer: It indicates the enantiomeric purity or the absolute configuration of the crystal.

data.question: Is the absorption coefficient for Rh-2S higher than that for Rh-1S?
Was the refinement method for Rh-2R the same as for Rh-1S?
What is the role of the GOF (Goodness of Fit) on F2 in the refinement of Rh-1S?
data.answer: It measures the quality of the fit of the observed to the calculated data.

data.question: Why is the crystal size important in the collection of X-ray diffraction data for Rh-2R?
data.answer: Because it affects the quality and completeness of the collected data.
